title: Aluminum Falls from Over 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK fell to $3,100 per tonne, retreating sharply from the over three-year high of $3,270 on January 28th as traders reconsidered speculative positions. Trading volumes for base metals in China remained at unprecedented highs, indicating position closures after metals tested peaks. Aluminum fell to 3,054.20 USD/T on February 2, down 2.04% from the previous day.

title: Aluminum and copper prices take breather after explosive start to 2026
summary: Aluminum steadied at $3,197.50 a ton on the LME, the highest in more than three years, while copper wavered around records after a strong start to the year. Investors are assessing future demand, especially in China, amid supply concerns and geopolitical risks. The advance is supported by expectations of tight supplies against demand, boosted by US Federal Reserve rate cuts and AI-driven enthusiasm for metals.

title: The Proportion of Liquid Aluminum in January Declined, Expected to Face a Significant Drop in February - SMM Analysis
summary: China's aluminum production in January 2026 increased 2.7% YoY and 0.5% MoM, but the proportion of liquid aluminum declined 4.4 percentage points to 72.1% due to weak demand, high prices, and production restrictions. As of end-January, existing capacity stood at 46.209 million mt and operating capacity at 44.996 million mt. February production is forecast to decrease MoM with liquid aluminum proportion dropping significantly to 64.4%.

title: The proportion of liquid aluminium in January declined, expected to face a significant drop in February
summary: China's aluminium production in January 2026 rose 2.7% Y-o-Y and 0.5% M-o-M, while liquid aluminium proportion fell 4.4 percentage points M-o-M to 72.1% amid off-season demand weakness and high prices. Existing capacity was 46.209 million tonnes and operating capacity 44.996 million tonnes at end-January. February forecasts predict M-o-M production decline and liquid aluminium proportion dropping 7.7 points to 64.4%.

title: US Aluminum Premium Hits Record High, Supply Tight in Early 2026
summary: The US Midwest Aluminum Premium hit a record $1.0095/lb on January 23, 2026, due to supply tightness from doubled import duties and depleted inventories. Market anticipates imports from Middle East, Asia, and Australia to ease pressure in Q1, while orders for aluminum products declined sharply by end-2025. European premiums also elevated, diverting Canadian supply away from the US.

title: US ALUMINUM: Extruders remain cautious for 2026 after an up-and-down 2025
summary: US aluminum extruders express caution for 2026 amid high billet costs, import competition, and uncertain trade policies, despite some strong January demand. New orders for extruded products rose 5.1% through November 2025 vs 2024, but shipments fell 1.4%. Expectations include potential tariff reforms on Canadian P1020 to lower premiums and boost demand.

title: US aluminium prices break away as tariffs collide with global supply strain
summary: US aluminium prices surged past USD 5000/tonne due to tariffs boosting domestic production like Century Aluminum's Mt. Holly restart (50kt idle capacity reactivated, full by June), falling imports, and shrinking stocks. Global strains include South32's Mozal smelter deactivation in Mozambique and Century's Grundartangi output cut by two-thirds in Iceland due to equipment issues.

title: Uzbekistan Launches Its First Aluminum Can Plant with IFC Support to Drive Sustainable Production
summary: Uzbekistan has launched its first greenfield aluminum can production plant in Tashkent with IFC's $18 million investment, aiming to supply recyclable metal packaging to beverage producers and reduce import reliance. The facility will produce up to 1.1 billion cans annually using energy-efficient equipment, create over 200 jobs, and align with climate goals through sustainable practices. IFC will also support environmental standards and green building certification.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices fell to 3,091 CNY/T on February 2, 2026, down 0.67% from the previous day, with rebar futures dropping to CNY 3,100 per tonne after testing five-month highs. Over the past month, prices rose 0.75%, but remain 5.13% lower year-over-year amid declining industrial metals and efforts to cap overcapacity.

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 02.02.2026
summary: SteelRadar provides real-time updates on global iron and steel exchanges, including Shanghai Futures rebar prices for 1-3 month terms as of February 2, 2026. The platform covers prices, news, analyses, and comments on the iron and steel industry worldwide.

title: Steel news and insights about steel market
summary: Recent updates include Jindal Steel reporting a sharp drop in quarterly profits and emissions in China's steel industry rising 4.4% year-over-year in December. Other news covers Acerinox considering US price raises and American rebar producers increasing prices by $60/t.

title: Metinvest targets higher steel production in 2026 despite scrap shortages
summary: Ukrainian steel and mining group Metinvest plans to increase steel production in 2026 by 300,000-500,000 metric tons, supported by higher scrap utilization primarily from the domestic market. Limited scrap availability has forced adjustments to output plans and increased reliance on pig iron in recent years. The company is considering a transition to electric arc furnace (EAF) steelmaking with 3.5-3.8 million mt capacity, but emphasizes the need for state policy to limit scrap exports.

title: Feb 2026 Metals Market: Pricing, Supply & Buyer Insights
summary: Stainless steel production remains disciplined as mills focus on margin control amid elevated alloy surcharges and selective demand. Metals markets show price movements of 3-8% compared to Q4 2025, driven by energy costs and global supply decisions. Blanket orders are recommended to manage ongoing price volatility and tight supply in 2026.

title: What Contractors Need to Know About Metal Prices Right Now - February 2026 Metal Roofing Market Update
summary: Steel mill prices are rising with extended lead times and backlogs affecting supply chains, while domestic steel production is slightly up. Inventory levels remain lean across the market, impacted by energy costs, winter weather, and construction demand. Contractors are advised to manage risks for Q1 and Q2 projects amid pricing volatility.

title: World Steel News - Issue 22 (4036)
summary: The latest World Steel News issue from February 3, 2026, covers global steel production updates, including notes on February production programs still being finalized as of February 2. It provides insights into ongoing steel industry developments worldwide.

title: Signs Point to a Bright Future for U.S. Green Steel in 2026
summary: U.S. steel manufacturing is experiencing growth with new green steel technologies that reduce environmental impact and production costs. Innovations include electric arc mini-mills that recycle steel scrap and eliminate coal dependency, with companies like Hertha Metals operating pilot plants that are 30% more energy efficient than traditional coal-based methods.

title: Green Steel Production: Hydrogen Tech & Future Trends
summary: This article examines hydrogen-driven green steel production technologies that are revolutionizing manufacturing in 2026, focusing on how hydrogen technology is transforming the steel industry toward more sustainable practices.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper rose to 5.88 USD/Lbs on February 3, 2026, up 0.97% from the previous day, though it fell to 5.83 USD/Lbs on February 2, down 1.54%. Over the past month, prices have declined but remain significantly higher year-over-year. The site reports ongoing market updates amid a broader metal selloff.

title: Copper Extends Losses in Broad Metal Selloff
summary: Copper fell more than 5% to around $5.5 per pound on Monday, reaching one-month lows and extending losses from the prior session. The metal is down about 15% from last week’s all-time high amid a continued broader metals selloff.

title: Copper is down by 2.01%
summary: Copper decreased 2.01% to 5.8051 USD/Lbs as part of recent market movements. This reflects short-term downward pressure in commodity trading.

title: Copper Prices Are Tumbling, and a Larger Correction Could Be ...
summary: Copper prices hit a record high above $14,000 per ton on Thursday but dropped to around $13,800 on Friday, aligning with declines in gold and silver. Goldman Sachs warns of a potential larger correction in mid-2026 due to US trade policy and tariffs on refined copper. Analysts note speculation over fundamentals, especially soft demand in China.

title: Copper Production Growth in 2026 is Flat to Modest: How Does This Impact Investors?
summary: Copper production growth in 2026 is projected to be flat to modest, with refined output expanding by only 0.9% compared to 3.4% in 2025, due to concentrate shortages and operational challenges. This shift is expected to create a refined copper deficit of 150,000 tonnes, reversing recent surpluses. Chinese smelters plan over 10% capacity cuts amid low margins.

title: Supply disruptions at copper mines driving higher prices likely to continue into 2026: Analyst
summary: Supply disruptions at copper mines, including issues at Freeport's Grasberg mine, are causing about 7% of production to miss full capacity this year, higher than the typical 5%. Analysts expect incremental growth from ramps like Manto Verde and potential projects like Sto Domingo. Negotiations with partners like First Quantum are anticipated soon.

title: Viewpoint: US copper faces uncertain 2026 outlook
summary: US copper prices are expected to remain volatile in 2026 due to uncertain Chinese demand, supply constraints, and record-high inventories in CME warehouses exceeding 453,000 tonnes. Market participants anticipate a supply deficit from lack of new mines and slipping South American output. Price forecasts vary, with Citigroup predicting above $5.90/lb by Q2 2026.

title: The hidden powers of porous copper
summary: Researchers at Arizona State University have developed a 3D-printing method using micro continuous liquid interface production (µCLIP) to create intricate copper components with nanoscale pores. This innovation allows engineering copper to intentionally oxidize for applications in information security, such as self-destructing chips exposed to air. The technology also supports sustainable manufacturing and medical implants that safely disintegrate.

title: Nuton: A better way to produce copper
summary: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology is enabling the Johnson Camp mine to become the lowest-carbon primary copper producer, setting a new benchmark for sustainability in copper mining. The technology drives lower emissions and improved environmental performance. It represents a significant advancement in sustainable copper production methods.

title: FHE materials bend the rules
summary: Screen-printed copper-based circuits for flexible hybrid electronics (FHE) offer cost-efficiency, mechanical flexibility, and environmental benefits. These innovations expand possibilities in electronics manufacturing. The technology emphasizes sustainability through reduced material use and adaptability.

title: Nickel Hits 4-week Low
summary: Nickel decreased to 16,867 USD/T, marking the lowest price since January 2026. Over the past 4 weeks, nickel lost 2.38%, though it has increased 11.62% over the last 12 months. On February 2, 2026, nickel fell to 17,010 USD/T, down 3.10% from the previous day.

title: Nickel Declines from Recent Peak
summary: Nickel futures in the UK sank to $17,700 per tonne after hovering near the 19-month high of $19,000 throughout January. The decline tracks drops in other base metals due to a rebounding dollar triggering the close of speculative positions. Contracts remain sharply higher since the start of the year.

title: [SMM Nickel Sulphate Daily Review] February 3: Weak Sentiment in Both Purchasing and Sales, Nickel Salt Prices Decline
summary: On February 3, the SMM battery-grade nickel sulphate index price stood at 31,939 yuan/mt. Weak sentiment affected both purchasing and sales, leading to declining prices for nickel salt. This reflects ongoing market pressures in the nickel sulphate segment.

title: The nickel production of Nornickel Russia in 2026 is expected to be similar to the previous year
summary: Nornickel of Russia expects its nickel production to reach 193,000-203,000 metric tons in 2026, roughly in line with 2025 levels after producing 198,521 tonnes last year, a 3% decrease but within projections. Palladium production is forecasted at 2.415-2.465 million ounces, down from 2.725 million in 2025. The company is advancing construction at Skalisty Mine to restore rich ore output.

title: Can nickel prices hit $25000 in 2026?
summary: Nickel prices rallied to $16,500–$18,500 per ton in early January 2026 due to Indonesia delaying mining permits, slashing output quotas, and shifting to value maximization from supply flooding. Indonesia, producing two-thirds of global nickel, utilized only 55% of its 2025 capacity, deflating the paper surplus. This supports higher prices and highlights strategic sulphide projects outside Indonesia.

title: Nickel Higher on Mine Suspension
summary: Nickel prices rose 1.6% to $16,910, breaking 14-month highs after Vale's Indonesia mine suspension and Indonesia's announcement to cut nickel ore output by a third in 2026 to support prices. The Indonesian mining minister confirmed reduced quotas amid broader supply concerns. This aligns with recent market support from policy shifts.

title: Indonesia quota talk triggers nickel reality check
summary: Indonesia's Nickel Miners Association suggests a 2026 ore cap of 250 million tonnes, down from 379 million in 2025, potentially removing 700,000 tonnes of nickel supply and flipping the market to deficit. Despite quota talks boosting prices, a large LME warranting reminded of near-term oversupply. Analysts note processing bottlenecks limit quick responses from new mines.

title: [SMM Analysis] 2025 Nickel Market Recap & 2026 Outlook: Oversupply to Weigh on Prices
summary: Indonesia's plan to cut 2026 nickel ore quotas sparked a price surge to $16,000/mt on LME in late December 2025. However, 2026 outlook predicts continued oversupply with a 120,000 mt global surplus from low-cost Indonesian MHP capacity. Demand from stainless steel and batteries grows modestly but insufficient to offset supply.

title: Indonesia caps 2026 nickel output while APNI warns of financial pressure on miners
summary: Indonesia's Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources set the 2026 nickel production quota at 250-260 million tons. This cap aligns with efforts to manage supply amid price support moves. APNI warns of financial pressures on miners from the restrictions.

title: Indonesia cuts 2026 nickel quota, global prices jump immediately
summary: Indonesia's decision to cut its 2026 nickel ore production quota immediately boosted global nickel prices. The policy shift impacts markets as the dominant producer reins in supply. This follows recent announcements tightening quotas.

title: Nickel Industries showcases sustainability in quarterly update
summary: Nickel Industries Limited reported stable operations in its Q4 2025 quarterly update, achieving zero lost-time injuries over 17.7 million safe man-hours and a low TRIFR of 0.68, underscoring its safety culture. The company advanced sustainability through a strategic investment in Excelsior Nickel Cobalt for nickel cathode offtake and received awards for ESG leadership. This reflects ongoing commitment to workforce protection and sustainable business initiatives.

title: The growing role of critical minerals in global innovation
summary: Demand for critical minerals like nickel for EVs and clean energy tech is projected to rise over 3.4 times by 2040 under net-zero scenarios. The article emphasizes responsible mining through collaboration to balance environmental stewardship, community benefits, and supply needs. Leaders at the 2026 WEF Annual Meeting will discuss aligning economic growth with sustainability.

title: Can nickel prices hit $25000 in 2026?
summary: Nickel prices surged to $16,500–$18,500 per ton in early January 2026 amid supply dynamics and EV demand. The analysis highlights the strategic importance of low-carbon nickel sulphide projects like Canada Nickel's Crawford in Ontario, as Indonesia's ore grades decline and costs rise. This positions high-quality, sustainable sources as essential for secure supply chains.

title: Aluminum, Copper, and Nickel Enter a Critical Period of Transformation! Lightweighting and Computing Power Innovation Drive
summary: Aluminum, copper, and nickel are undergoing transformation driven by lightweighting technologies and computing power innovations. The article discusses restructuring in these metals sectors amid technological advancements. Sustainability and efficiency improvements are key focuses in this critical period.

title: Tenaris in Italy achieves ASME certification for the supply of materials for the nuclear sector
summary: Tenaris's Dalmine seamless steel pipe mill in Italy completed qualification to supply certified materials for nuclear facilities designed to ASME III standards. The certification enables Tenaris to serve both European and international markets for new nuclear plant construction and maintenance of existing facilities as part of the global energy transition.
